result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean CAMPBELL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both, as long as SSI is not effected.

Obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with the victim.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Register as a sexual offender.

Comply with all sex offender requirements.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean CAMPBELL

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2nd degree sexual assault of child.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 10-20-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with females under the age of 18 and no contact with C.C.B., DOB: 11-26-1999.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
